Effective (open of) April 16th 2015, Asia Index Private Limited (AIPL) has cancelled BSE MID CAP, BSE SMALL CAP, BSE HEALTHCARE, BSE IT and BSE FMCG indices and replaced them with BSE MidCap, BSE SmallCap, BSE Healthcare, BSE Information Technology and BSE Fast Moving Consumer Goods, respectively. For more information please click here The closing value as of April 15th 2015 for respective legacy indices is used as base index value for the new indices. For more information you may write to us at bseindex@bseindia.com", "images": [], "rank": 3}, {"url": "https://tradingeconomics.com/india/stock-market", "content": "BSE SENSEX Stock Market Index - Quote - Chart - Historical Data - News | Trading Economics Calendar News Markets Commodities Indexes Shares Currencies Crypto Bonds Earnings Indicators Countries Forecasts Commodities Indexes Currencies Crypto Bonds Countries Indicators Members DATA PLANS Download historical data for 20 million indicators using your browser. Login Calendar News Markets Commodities Indexes Shares Currencies Crypto Bonds Earnings Holidays Countries United States United Kingdom Euro Area Australia Canada Japan China Brazil Russia India More Countries Indicators Interest Rate Inflation Rate Unemployment Rate GDP Growth GDP per Capita Current Account Gold Reserves Government Debt Crude Oil Production Gasoline Prices Credit Rating More Indicators Forecasts Markets & Indicators Countries Countries Indicators Commodities Indexes Currencies Crypto Bonds Solutions Data Subscriptions API Access Widgets Pricing Apps App Store Google Play Twitter About Customers Investors Careers About us Contact BSE SENSEX Stock Market Index Quote - Chart - Historical Data - News Summary Stats Forecast Alerts The BSE Sensex was almost flat, trading around 85,011 in Monday morning trade, after falling in the previous three sessions, amid thin trading and persistent foreign outflows, which continued to curb risk appetite. Foreign portfolio investors remained net sellers, with outflows amounting to $35.43 million on Friday, according to provisional data, bringing the total to $1.64 billion in December so far. Gains in metals and manufacturing helped offset declines in financial services and banking. The benchmarks have traded in a narrow range in recent sessions amid a lack of strong catalysts. Traders await the release of Indian industrial and manufacturing production data due later today, while an upbeat session on Wall Street on Friday helped support sentiment. Tata Steel rose 2.4%, JSW Steel climbed 1.0%, while Adani Ports and Power Grid fell 1.2% and 0.9%, respectively. Meanwhile, Coforge advanced 0.9% after the company said on Friday it would acquire artificial intelligence firm Encora. India's main stock market index, the SENSEX, fell to 84807 points on December 29, 2025, losing 0.28% from the previous session. Over the past month, the index has declined 0.97%, though it remains 8.38% higher than a year ago, according to trading on a contract for difference (CFD) that tracks this benchmark index from India. Historically, the BSE SENSEX Stock Market Index reached an all time high of 86159.02 in December of 2025. BSE SENSEX Stock Market Index - data, forecasts, historical chart - was last updated on December 29 of 2025. India's main stock market index, the SENSEX, fell to 84807 points on December 29, 2025, losing 0.28% from the previous session. Over the past month, the index has declined 0.97%, though it remains 8.38% higher than a year ago, according to trading on a contract for difference (CFD) that tracks this benchmark index from India. The BSE SENSEX Stock Market Index is expected to trade at 84968.13 points by the end of this quarter, according to Trading Economics global macro models and analysts expectations. Looking forward, we estimate it to trade at 78629.33 in 12 months time. Please review the copyright information in the series notes before sharing. Share Graph Custom Graph Link Embed in Website Graph Image Link Account Tools Add to Data List Get Email Notification Notes Source: S&P Dow Jones Indices LLC Release: Standard & Poors Units: Index ,Not Seasonally Adjusted Frequency: Daily, Close Notes: The observations for the S&P 500 represent the daily index value at market close. The market typically closes at 4 PM ET, except for holidays when it sometimes closes early. The Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis and S&P Dow Jones Indices LLC have reached a new agreement on the use of Standard & Poors and Dow Jones Averages series in FRED. FRED and its associated services will include 10 years of daily history for Standard & Poors and Dow Jones Averages series. The S&P 500 is regarded as a gauge of the large cap U.S. equities market. The index includes 500 leading companies in leading industries of the U.S. economy, which are publicly held on either the NYSE or NASDAQ, and covers 75% of U.S. equities. Since this is a price index and not a total return index, the S&P 500 index here does not contain dividends. Copyright 2016, S&P Dow Jones Indices LLC. All rights reserved. Robo-Advisors Best Personal Loans Best Debt Relief Companies View All Markets News, Dec. 26, 2025: Stock Indexes Log Weekly Gains After Quiet Friday Session, Holiday-Shortened Week By Aaron Rennie Read Full Bio A former Senior Publishing Editor on the Dow Jones Newswires team at The Wall Street Journal, Aaron earned a Bachelor's degree in Economics from the University of Michigan and a Master's in Journalism from Columbia University. Learn about our editorial policies Updated December 26, 2025 04:09 PM EST The three major stock indexes all rose by more than 1% this week. Spencer Platt / Getty Images Major stock indexes ended a largely positive holiday week quietly. After traders got the day off for Christmas, the tech-heavy Nasdaq closed down 0.1% and the blue-chip Dow Jones Industrial Average fell fractionally. The benchmark S&P 500 set a new intraday high before finishing fractionally lower. The three indexes, which snapped five-session winning streaks Friday, nevertheless all rose by more than 1% for the week. Gold and silver futures set all-time highs Friday, rising to about $4,585 and $79 an ounce, respectively to extend their recent upward runs. Miner Freeport-McMoRan ( FCX ) was one of the top performers in the S&P 500 Friday, with shares finishing up 2.2%. Target ( TGT ) stock rose more than 3% to lead the S&P 500 after the Financial Times reported that hedge fund and activist investor Toms Capital Investment Management had taken a stake in the retailer. Shares of Nvidia ( NVDA ), the world's most valuable public company, rose 1%. On Wednesday, AI chip designer Groq said it had entered into a licensing agreement with Nvidia for its inference technology, and CNBC reported that Nvidia acquired assets worth $20 billion in cash. The 10-year Treasury yield , which influences interest rates on a variety of commercial and consumer loans, was little changed at 4 p.m. ET from Wednesday's close of 4.13%. Spencer Platt | Getty Images The S&P 500 reached a new high on Friday and posted weekly gains as traders came back from the Christmas holiday. The broad market index closed down 0.03% to end at 6,929.94. At its high, the S&P 500 was up 0.2%, reaching 6,945.77. The Nasdaq Composite slipped 0.09% and closed at 23,593.10. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 20.19 points, or 0.04%, and settled at 48,710.97. For the week, the S&P 500 gained 1.4%, notching its fourth weekly advance in five weeks. The Dow and Nasdaq were also up more than 1% week to date. \"People are taking profits here and there, or buying on lows, but there's not a lot of information. You're not getting corporate profit results. You're not getting a lot of economic data, so it's probably just more technicals and positioning heading into here,\" said Tom Hainlin, national investment strategist at U.S. Bank Asset Management. The strategist highlighted the recent broadening that's been taking place in the market as a trade in play for the new year, noting that the S&P 500's rise to fresh records Wednesday wasn't propelled by the technology sector but rather financials and industrials two cyclical areas of the U.S. economy. \"That just gives more confidence heading into 2026 that it's not just tech here and everybody behind them. It's the market benefiting from the tax bill that was signed in July, the rate cuts that came in the fourth quarter of this year,\" he continued. \"Heading into 2026, those are some tailwinds.\" Investors are also in a historically strong seasonal period, as they await a potential Santa Claus rally . The surge occurs between the last five trading days of the year and the first two of the new year. Data from the Stock Trader's Almanac shows the S&P 500 averages a 1.3% gain during that time going back to 1950. Fri, Dec 26 2025 4:15 PM EST Stocks close little changed The three leading U.S. indexes finished relatively unchanged on Friday. The S&P 500 fell 0.03% to 6,929.94, while the Nasdaq Composite dropped 0.09% to 23,593.10. The Dow Jones Industrial Average also slipped 20.19 points, or 0.04%, to 48,710.97.
